name: Space Resonator
description:
Space Resonator is a rhythm game based on violin.

Contrary to the common controls of rhythm games which use key press, Space Resonator uses mainly mouse movement for a bi-directional control similar to bowing a string instrument.  

 

Music Used

Due to the schedule and copyrights constraints, only one famous violin piece is added to the game, namely Paganini's Caprice No.24. All variations are split up into 12 parts in-game so the player can retry certain variation without going through the whole piece again. More information about the piece can be found under the Credits section.

 

 

Controls

Using mouse to control is highly recommended in the game and should be the preferred controls. The mouse up and left movements are mapped to the left direction control whereas the down and right movements are mapped to the right direction control (pictorial explanation is available in the screenshot section as well as in the game menu).
